sentence.idiomatic: This investment is more than a hundred million RMB, you'd better be a little careful.
You've got to be careful when buying sunglasses, pay close attention to the quality of the lenses.
It's all my fault for not being careful enough otherwise how could I have been cheated?
Experts predict that the bull market will continue for a lengthy period of time.
The bear market is finally over, and you're not rushing to take advantage of the bull market and earn a little more money?
The bull market is also risky, investors shouldn't be too blind. They've got to make sure what they are buying.
These two companies are exceptional. One has tremendous financial strength, while one has tremendous technological capabilities.
This university has rich pedagogical resources, and is a school that students yearn to attend.
This ball team has used its extraordinary strength to carry off another championship cup.
Last year the inflation in the housing market was not terribly apparent.
I've heard that the rising trend in this stock isn't bad, you can think about it.
In the last several months, the phenomenon whereby the Chinese stock market has risen wildly has attracted the attention of a great many economists.
Drawn by the bull market, a large number of private investors are entering the stock market every day.
As is understood, there are many private investors understand little about the stock market, and enjoy blindly following trends.
A big problem private investors face is the paucity of sources for accurate and fast knowledge.

word.literal: to be unable to say for certain

sentence.idiomatic: Don't think the current rise in the stock market is that good, it's hard to say when it will collapse.
After the last stock market crash, he has withdrew from the stock market.
He believes that the recent small drop in the price of stocks will not cause a market collapse.
I really hate those people who talk about things that they know nothing about. They can't do it themselves and still criticize others for not doing it well.
Who says that the best one isn't the one with the most points. As far as I can tell, it's only the people who knows nothing about it will believe that it's true.
You can't buy it yourself and still say this thing of mine is worthless? You're really someone who doesn't know what they're talking about.
He's the sort of person who doesn't envy others for their wealth.
His success today is entirely a product of his own exertions. Don't be envious of him.
This opportunity is hard to come by, countless people envy you, how can you give it up?
You wouldn't do this if you have pay attention to the people around you.
When buying electronics, you've also got to pay attention to the quality of the accessories.
I've discovered that he'd changed a bit after returning from his trip, I don't know if you've noticed this or not.
Have you been buying stock lately?
Nope. I think the stock market is overheated now, so it's good to be a bit cautious.

word.literal: to be incapable of becoming rich

sentence.idiomatic: No wonder you aren't rich. The Chinese stock market is in its biggest bull market in the last dozen years. Between the extraordinary mass of public capital, and then the 2008 Olympics and 2010 World Fair, there will be growth for at least two to three years. So I took the plunge and bought a lot of stock this year.

Don't be too optimistic. The reason I feel scared is exactly because everyone is talking like you. The Chinese stock market still isn't mature yet. There are too many private investors, and they're all looking at the short term, lacking both rational analysis and a certain psychological endurance. This makes putting money in the stock market extraordinarily risky.
No kidding. Can there be investment without risk? The critical thing is keeping a good attitude. I'm interested in the long-term at least, and indifferent to short-term fluctuations.

But right now many of the new entrants are acting blindly - buying stocks on the market without even knowing what they are. This way the market will easily give into panics, and more seriously, the market collapses.
Don't talk about something you know nothing about. I really disapprove of a craven like you, cowardly folk who can't bear risk, but get envious whenever they see others making money.

I'm envious? I'm not that immature. I'm just saying that the stock market is overheated. As an investor, you need a certain amount of mental preparation. I'll also remind you that stock market speculation is not so different from gambling.
Your way of thinking is too outdated. Right now all you can do is to prepare yourself well, and pay attention to the market developments, then you'll get it.
How can it be that easy? If this is all it takes, then everyone would be rich.
Forget it. You're just standing on the sidelines burning with envy. There's no point in talking to you.
